group_1.textRight: I'm relieved Tsuyu Mizuna was able to meet@Chizuru without any complications.

group_1.textLeft: Looks like everything's going@according to history.

group_1.textRight: Correct.
Albeit they've made very poor@impressions on each other.

group_1.textLeft: I know, right?!
Princess Tsuyu is convinced the Taito Gang@are controlling the Demons...

group_1.textRight: It looks like they have a long way@to go before becoming friends...

group_1.textLeft: Agh, c'mon, little Magpie!@You gotta help 'em team up!
Help them bring everyone together@so they can overcome the famine...!

group_1.textRight: It's the only way we can save@Iroha's concept…
Um, say, do you know what will happen@here after the famine gets resolved...?
My knowledge ends with Tsuyu@and Chizuru saving the people.
I'm unsure of what happened afterward.

group_1.textLeft: Isn't it written in Iroha's book?

group_1.textRight: Iroha returned before those events@played out.

group_1.textLeft: ...I guess now we just have to wait and see@what Lord Masatsuna has to say.
It seems there is no dispute regarding@the Sumiya Clan's heir.
Unlike his predecessor, a man of cunning who@feared being preyed upon in these chaotic times,
the new lord is a witless coward.

group_1.textRight: In the end, the moratorium@didn't come to pass...

group_1.textLeft: I had some hope he would have the decency@to allow us to take up such measures…
...But alas, having been born and raised in Kyoto,@he is fully willing to protect his vested interests,
but feels no obligation@to protect the people.

group_1.textRight: ...So the people of Hokuyo are expected@to keep enduring this hell?
And the people of Sango have@suffered to the point of rebellion...!

group_1.textLeft: Hold your tongue.@I've not finished speaking.

group_1.textRight: ...My apologies.

group_1.textLeft: It's alright, Tsuyu.
If our liege won't act, then we'll take@matters into our own hands.

group_1.textRight: Father...?!

group_1.textLeft: While doing so will impact our revenue,@we will forgive all our loans,
and we will pay only ten percent of@the annual tribute this year.

group_1.textRight: Strictly the amount owed to@the Sumiya Clan...

group_1.textLeft: All they need is ten percent of@our private fortune.
We can manage without that@for a year or so.
As for the money owed to the temple,@Gen'un said he will take care of it.

group_1.textRight: So the people of Sango...?

group_1.textLeft: They will still owe their debts to@the other lords,
but with their loan to the temple forgiven,@they will be somewhat better off.
...But it will be hard on everyone.

group_1.textRight: In doing this, our old comrades will@look upon us with disgust.
I'm sure we'll be pariahs among@the other vassals...

group_1.textLeft: Will you resent me for it?

group_1.textRight: Quite the contrary. I think it is a wise@decision that will protect the land.

group_1.textLeft: I'm pleased you think so.
As reflected in our heirloom seal, the Mizuna Clan@has protected the people since time immemorial,
to the point of shirking our pride for@the sake of that duty.
I'm not so old as to forget that.
In the end, while we couldn't enact@a moratorium for everyone,
Mizuna and Suitoku agreed to cooperate@to reduce the people's burden.

group_1.textRight: It'll be rough going, but it's still@a step forward.

group_1.textLeft: Still, knowing the Demons caused all this, it feels@like we've only made a single move on the board...

group_1.textRight: But without that one move,@we won't be able to unite everyone.
That's right! I hope this will be@the first step in saving them all...!

group_1.textLeft: It surely will.
Tomorrow, I ought to go give@my thanks to Gen'un.
